thread.title: Diageo faces claims it artificially inflated sales
thread.title_full: Diageo faces claims it artificially inflated sales

title: Diageo faces claims it artificially inflated sales
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Jul 24, 2015, 01:34 BST - UK Markets open in 6 hrs 26 mins Diageo faces claims it artificially inflated sales By Andrew Trotman | Telegraph – 14 minutes ago 1,907.00 -10.00 
SEC (Shanghai: 603988.SS - news ) asks British drinks giant for further information on allegations it sent more cases of alcohol to its clients than they required 
Diageo is under scrutiny in the US over claims it has artifically boosted sales. 
The British drinks giant, which makes Smirnoff vodka and Guinness, has been contacted by the Securities and Exchange Commission , which is looking into how the company has shipped stock to distributors. 
Diageo (LSE: DGE.L - news ) has allegedly been sending more cases of alcohol to its clients than they require, allowing it to report higher sales and shipments. 
In a statement, the FTSE 100 company said: “Diageo has received an inquiry from the US Securities and Exchange Commission regarding its distribution in the United States. Diageo is working to respond fully to the SEC’s requests for information in this matter.” 
The SEC declined to comment on the allegations, which were first reported by the Wall Street Journal . 
The US is a key market for Diageo, making up a third of its $17.6bn (£11.3bn) sales and 45pc of operating profits. It holds around 20pc of North America’s spirits market, according to industry tracker Impact Databank. 
In April, the group, which has been the subject of takeover speculation , said net sales fell 0.7pc in its third quarter on flagging global demand and the after-effects of a weak economic recovery. 
Jorge Paulo Lemann, who founded private equity firm 3G Capital (Other OTC: CGHC - news ) and owns a stake in Anheuser-Busch InBev, the world’s largest brewer, has reportedly been eying a bid for Diageo.
